quest.name: The Threat of Superiority
journal: Guildmaster Cocobuki urges you ever deeper into the yawning abyss of thaumaturgy.
Listen to Cocobezi as he instructs you from the chapter entitled “The Threat of Superiority.”

A trio of furious merchants have come to demand recompense for the crate of ether consumed by the guildmaster siblings. Elicit the traders' sympathy by crying, and convince them to leave empty-handed.
Your tears have convinced the merchants to leave without pressing their case for repayment. Report your success to Cocobezi.

You have been assigned a trial that requires you to destroy the cursed artifact known as Mormo's urn. Keeping in mind how effective a well-timed Sleep spell can be, track down and defeat the Alacran thieves who have stolen the urn and are now traveling in the southeast of Drybone.
You have defeated the Alacran thieves and destroyed Mormo's urn. Return to the Thaumaturges' Guild and report to Cocobezi.

Cocobuki is impressed with your control and skill in the midst of an unexpected situation. You are, however, concerned with the change that has come over Cocobusi after the unusual events of your trial. Endeavor to keep your lessons fresh in your mind as you return to your training in thaumaturgy.

※The next thaumaturge quest will be available from Cocobuki upon reaching level 20.
objectives: /cry to elicit sympathy from the furious merchants.
Lie in wait at the designated location.
Report to Cocobezi at the Thaumaturges' Guild.

dialogue.name: COCOBUKI
dialogue.text: Come, Forename, the yawning abyss beckons once more.

dialogue.name: COCOBUKI
dialogue.text: Today, Cocobezi will instruct you from the chapter entitled, “The Threat of Superiority.”

dialogue.name: COCOBEZI
dialogue.text: You are come for your lesson, Forename? Then heed well my words...

dialogue.name: COCOBEZI
dialogue.text:
“The Threat of Superiority.
Ah, how magnificent the intimidating power we wield. Flames sear the air, ice frosts the ground, and lightning flashes with blinding incandescence.

dialogue.name: COCOBEZI
dialogue.text: “But not all are cowed by our elemental fury. Ignite not your flames, summon not your ice, and strike not with your lightning. Know you this threat, and stay your hand against such foes.”

dialogue.name: COCOBEZI
dialogue.text: Once you cut away all the overblown imagery, the passage draws attention to an important tactic: a wise thaumaturge does not engage in battle against opponents shehe cannot defeat.

dialogue.name: COCOBEZI
dialogue.text: A fine example would be avoiding conflict with Ul'dah's multitude of furious merchants. These soulless, ravening creatures are afflicted with the madness of insatiable avarice.

dialogue.name: COCOBEZI
dialogue.text: Do you perhaps recall the crate of ether you retrieved from the Amalj'aa bandits? Well, a number of irate peddlers have arrived at the guild with the gall to demand recompense for the few measly vials we emptied as our just reward.

dialogue.name: COCOBEZI
dialogue.text: ...Alright, yes, we drank the entire bloody box. But the point is that the guild cannot presently afford to pay such a sum. Thus, I pass on to you the secret of my last and most potent defense:

dialogue.name: COCOBEZI
dialogue.text: Shameless weeping.

dialogue.name: COCOBEZI
dialogue.text: I'm not speaking of a few tears here─I want you to stride right up to these tyrannical traders and cry your eyes out.

dialogue.name: SHOUNINA
dialogue.text: Hey! You ether-swilling miscreant! Where's the gil you owe me!?

dialogue.name: SHOUNINA
dialogue.text: I... Alright, alright, missson! I know you're the one who chased down those Amalj'aa brutes for us. I'll let it go this one time. For your sake.

dialogue.name: SHOUNINB
dialogue.text: Thaumaturge! What manner of guild are you running here!? Do you simply loot and pillage the goods of fine, upstanding citizens as you see fit!?

dialogue.name: SHOUNINB
dialogue.text: It's not that─ Oh dear, I'm not angry at you, you understand. It's those five, ether-addled brothers I take issue with. You tell them the next time this happens, I'll have the price taken out of their unprincipled hides!

dialogue.name: SHOUNINC
dialogue.text: Ye ought to be ashamed of yerself! Did yer mother never teach ye that a merchant's to be paid for his wares!?

dialogue.name: SHOUNINC
dialogue.text: Well, y-ye needn't cry about a few vials of ether, lasslad. I'll tell ye what: ye dry yer eyes for me, an' I'll take care o' the loss out o' me own purse.

dialogue.name: COCOBEZI
dialogue.text: A masterful performance, Forename. The sniffling was a nice touch. You will, however, encounter foes who are unmoved by such piteous wailings. Take this recent request, for instance, which I have nominated to serve as your next trial...

dialogue.name: COCOBEZI
dialogue.text: A team of scholars has asked for a thaumaturge to destroy a cursed relic they unearthed known as “Mormo's urn.” While pottery is, by and large, immune to tears, it is the Alacran thieves that subsequently stole it that concern me.

dialogue.name: COCOBEZI
dialogue.text: The Alacran are an organization of criminals not normally known for their gentle or understanding dispositions. Rather than attempting to engage an entire gang of their thugs, I would suggest you neutralize the threat to your person with a well-timed Sleep spell.

dialogue.name: COCOBEZI
dialogue.text: The Alacran have been seen traveling in the southeast of Drybone. Find them, and destroy the urn they carry.

dialogue.name: COCOBUSI
dialogue.text: Forename, a moment, if you please! Pray allow me to shatter that urn!

dialogue.name: COCOBUSI
dialogue.text: I... I thought that if I assisted you with your task, then my brothers might finally deign to take me seriously. So, I followed you.

dialogue.name: TOUZOKU
dialogue.text: What've we got here, then? A couple o' nosy sand rabbits that're about to get skinned!

dialogue.name: COCOBUSI
dialogue.text: Oh, dear gods! Where did they come from!?

dialogue.name: COCOBUSI
dialogue.text: That was simply incredible, Forename. I wish I could wield the same sort of power.

dialogue.name: COCOBUSI
dialogue.text: I became an alchemist in the hopes of creating some manner of mana-amplifying elixir, but all my efforts have been for naught. The results have been far too mild to make any difference.

dialogue.name: COCOBUSI
dialogue.text: I'll never be a thaumaturge like my brothers at this rate. I'll forever be the pitiful, powerless little sibling.

dialogue.name: COCOBUSI
dialogue.text: Mormo's urn. If I destroy it, then maybe my family will see what I'm capable of...

dialogue.name: SUCCUBUS
dialogue.text: (-Mormo's Urn-)Wait, wait, wait, wait, WAIT! Don't you DARE break my urn!

dialogue.name: COCOBUSI
dialogue.text: Ahhh! What the─!? Did that piece of pottery just talk? Are...are you Mormo, the voidsent!?

dialogue.name: SUCCUBUS
dialogue.text: (-Mormo-)Hee hee, well, yes, I AM Mormo. But I'm one of the NICE voidsent.

dialogue.name: SUCCUBUS
dialogue.text: (-Mormo-)It was the NASTY ones that sealed me up in here for helping a mortal. If you would be so kind as to open the lid of my urn, I would be HAPPY to grant you a wish! Anything you desire! Fortune? Fame?

dialogue.name: COCOBUSI
dialogue.text: I... I'm not really interested in fame or fortune. But perhaps there is one thing: I'd like to have aetheric power to equal that of my brothers...

dialogue.name: SUCCUBUS
dialogue.text: (-Mormo-)Hee hee! POWER, is it? A perfectly acceptable wish! In fact, I sense the latent ability buried deep within your spirit. It will be a SIMPLE thing for me to turn it loose!

dialogue.name: SUCCUBUS
dialogue.text: (-Mormo-)...What more is there to think about? OPEN the lid!

dialogue.name: COCOBUSI
dialogue.text: Hmmm. Well, I don't feel different at all. I think Mormo may have been lying.

dialogue.name: COCOBUSI
dialogue.text: Come, Forename, it's time we were leaving. Oh, weren't we supposed to break this urn?

dialogue.name: COCOBUSI
dialogue.text: And that is that! Yes, this will be such FUN─ Ahem, I mean, it will be nice to return home after all this excitement.

dialogue.name: COCOBEZI
dialogue.text: Welcome back, Forename. I am glad to see you making a habit out of not dying.

dialogue.name: COCOBEZI
dialogue.text: Before we discuss your trial further, however, I would ask you about Cocobusi. When I saw him but a few moments ago, he seemed...odd. Well, odder than usual. Would you happen to know aught of it?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: How do you respond?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Cocobusi joined me at my trial.

dialogue.name: COCOBEZI
dialogue.text: Your eyes betray the secret within your breast. If you do not aid me in aiding my brother, things will go ill for you, Forename.

dialogue.name: COCOBEZI
dialogue.text: He... Busi was at your trial!?

dialogue.name: COCOBUKI
dialogue.text: It is extraordinarily dangerous and foolish to interfere with a thaumaturge's training. I shall have to scold him most heartily.

dialogue.name: COCOBUKI
dialogue.text: <sigh> Such unpleasantness aside, I am impressed that you claimed victory in spite of this unexpected development. The teachings of the Yawning Abyss have served you well.

dialogue.name: COCOBUKI
dialogue.text: With your experience and control thus demonstrated, I believe you are ready to add a new spell to your repertoire─Scathe. This elementally neutral blast of force will prove effective against all manner of opponents.

dialogue.name: COCOBUKI
dialogue.text: As I am sure you are eager to test this incantation's efficacy, I shall grant you leave to return to your training. Hm hm hm... I pity the next hostile creature that crosses your path.

dialogue.name: SCENE00013
dialogue.text:
Duty calls. Do you wish to proceed with
“The Threat of Superiority”?

dialogue.name: SCENE00013
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: SCENE00013
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: COCOBUSI
dialogue.text: I'm no thaumaturge, but I still have my tricks!

dialogue.name: COCOBUSI
dialogue.text: Are you injured!? I have a salve for that!
